info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 1 at 10:03PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage AK
info.description:
ESFAFC
As of 19:15 AKDT Thursday, ice began running past Stony River and water levels rose approximately 2 ft. As of 21:00 AKDT the ice continues to run and the water levels are steady.
The River Watch team on Wednesday saw no intact ice until 8 miles upstream of the Tatlawitsuk River. River Watch also confirmed on Wednesday that the Tatlawitsuk, Swift, and Stony rivers were all free of ice. On Thursday evening, local residents in Stony River assume this run is intact ice that was released between Devils Elbow and upstream of the Tatlawitsuk River.
At this time, the NWS urges residents in Stony River, Sleetmute, Red Devil, and Crooked Creek to be prepared for rising water levels and runs of ice through the evening into Friday morning. As of 15:00 AKDT the Kuskokwim River is free of ice all the way to approximately Chuathbaluk, and any ice jams would be from temporary grounding through low water reaches. Estimated time for the ice to reach Crooked Creek is approximately 08:00 AKDT. At this time we are not expecting any flooding to occur.
This Hydrologic Outlook will be revised on Friday morning once we receive additional information regarding location and integrity of the ice run.
The River Watch Team will continue to reach out to local community members for observations, and fly Friday morning as soon as weather permits to assess river conditions between Bethel and upstream of Crooked Creek. To share any local observations, please email anchorage.weather@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Kuskokwim Valley West; Kuskokwim Valley East
